at- tend. Prince Andrew came in to inform the commander in chief of this and, availing him- self of permission previously given him by Ku- tiizov to be present at the council, he remained in the room. 
"Since Prince Bagration is not coming, we may begin," said Weyrother, hurriedly rising from his seat and going up to the table on which an enormous map of the environs of Briinn was spread out.
